'''Huntail''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ハンテール''' ''Huntail'') is a {{type|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Clamperl}} when [[Trade#Pokémon which evolve when traded|traded]] holding a [[Deep Sea Tooth]]. It is one of Clamperl's final forms, the other being {{p|Gorebyss}}.

==Biology==
Huntail is a light-blue aquatic Pokémon with a serpentine body. Orange, semi-circular fins run the length of its spine, and there are two additional fins on the underside of its lower jaw. A large, fan-like fin projects from the top of its head. Its body and face is dotted with white spots that are bordered by orange rings. There are also orange rings surrounding its eyes, and it has a large mouth filled with sharp teeth. The tip of its tail is shaped similarly to a fish with a single dorsal and pectoral fin and glowing eyespots. 

It uses its fish-like tail to attract prey, and then uses its mouth to grab and swallow the prey whole. It swims by wiggling its body, though it is not the strongest swimmer, and its eyes can see even in darkness. Its sturdy spine allows it to survive high pressure deep under the {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Sea Pokémon|sea}}. According to tradition, something unfortunate will happen if Huntail wash up onshore.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
====Major appearances====
[[File:Keith Huntail.png|left|thumb|250px|Huntail in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
Huntail debuted in ''[[AG095|The Evolutionary War]]''. In that particular episode, a person has to be on [[Island C]] to evolve {{p|Clamperl}} into a Huntail. One such Huntail belongs to {{OBP|Keith|AG095}}.

====Minor appearances====
A Huntail made a cameo appearance in ''[[AG094|The Relicanth Really Can]]''.

A Huntail appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

Multiple Huntail appeared in ''[[M09|Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of the Sea]]''.

A Huntail appeared in ''[[DP089|Up Close and Personable!]]''

Multiple Huntail appeared in one of the aquarium tanks in ''[[XY022|Going for the Gold!]]''.

{{Animedexheader|Hoenn}}
{{Animedexbody|AG095|Huntail|Ash's Pokédex|Huntail, the Deep Sea Pokémon. Huntail is the evolved form of {{p|Clamperl}}. It uses its fish shaped tail to entice prey before snapping it up in its large jaws.}}
{{Animedexfooter/Pokémon|''Advanced Generation''|Hoenn}}

===In Pokémon Generations===
[[File:Tentacool Huntail Carvanha Clamperl PG.png|thumb|250px|Huntail in [[Pokémon Generations]]]]
Two wild Huntail appeared in the waters that surrounded the [[Mossdeep Space Center]] in ''[[PG08|The Cavern]]''.
{{-}}

==In the manga==
[[File:Briney Water Pokémon Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Huntail in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Huntail has appeared in aquariums belonging to [[Mr. Briney]] and [[Team Aqua]] in ''[[PS192|Stick This in Your Craw, Crawdaunt I]]''. 

It also made a cameo appearance as a Pokémon that {{adv|Sapphire}} swam on while she trained herself to be part of the wild in ''[[PS259|Rayquaza Redemption II]]''.

==Trivia==
* Despite being a pure {{type|Water}} Pokémon, it bears a {{type|Dark}} Poké Assist in [[Pokémon Ranger: Shadows of Almia]].

===Origin===
It appears to have been based on the {{wp|gulper eel}}, {{wp|viperfish}} or {{wp|moray eel}}. It also resembles the rarely seen {{wp|oarfish}}, mainly because of its orange-colored crest and fins.

====Name origin====
Huntail may be a combination of ''hunt'' or 斑点 ''hanten'' (speck or fleck) and ''tail''.
